channel.title: rust on Amish K. Naidu
channel.description: Recent content in rust on Amish K. Naidu

item.title: Learn this one weird trick to write custom serde deserializers!
item.description: Serde is a great library for serializing/deserializing in Rust. It allows you to directly convert rust data structures using a few attributes. Most of the time, It Just Works â„¢ and when it doesn’t, you can write your own serializers or deserializers! Let’s follow the official documentation and try writing a deserializer for the following struct: struct Config { host: IpAddr, port: u16, } All you need to do is annotate it with #[derive(Deserialize)] and it will just work out of the box.
